intro: Coleus australis, commonly known as the New Zealand coleus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features square, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a distinctive reddish or purple underside. Its small, tubular flowers are typically pink or purple and are arranged in whorls along the stems. Coleus australis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Māori medicine.
